title: Vipers tab Blair, Toppert as assistants
text:
Vipers tab Blair, Toppert as assistants DENNIS SILVA II | STAFF WRITER The Monitor Posted on Oct 14, 2015 by Dennis Silva II 
The Vipers hired Joseph Blair and Cody Toppert as assistant coaches earlier this week. 
“One of the biggest things we’ve done with the Vipers is develop players and move them on,” said Matt Brase, entering his first year as Vipers head coach. “Having guys like Joseph and Cody who know what it takes to get to the next level is big. It’s important they can relate to players and that players respect them.” 
Blair, 41, and Toppert, 32, each bring a blend of playing and coaching experience. 
Blair was the 35th overall pick by the Seattle SuperSonics in the 1996 NBA Draft. He played professionally from 1996-2009, mostly in Europe, after playing four seasons (1992-1996) at Arizona, where he is still the Wildcats’ all-time leader in field goal percentage and eighth in career blocks. 
Blair, who averaged 10.4 points and 6.5 rebounds at Arizona, spent the last two seasons as a student assistant and graduate assistant at Arizona. He will oversee the Vipers’ defense. 
“The thing with Joseph is he’s knowledgeable,” said Brase, who has known Blair for quite some time. “He’s a former player, he’s played a long time overseas, and since he’s retired he’s been heavily involved with coaching, especially the last two years. He brings a good dynamic as a former player.” 
Brase learned of Toppert through basketball circles. 
Toppert is highly recognized for his work in player development, having spent the last two years as the Director of Basketball Development and coach for ELEV|8 Sports Institute in Florida. During the offseason, Toppert trained players preparing for the NBA Draft and international play. Additionally, he coached at many camps and clinics across the country, including the NBA Pre-Draft Combine in 2013 and 2014. 
Toppert — who finished eighth overall in Cornell history in points, first in 3-pointers made and first in career games played — played professionally in the NBA D-League with Albuquerque, where he helped win a 2005-2006 championship. He played professionally in New Zealand and across Europe until 2012. 
Toppert will oversee the Vipers’ offense. 
“Cody is a huge player development guy who has a lot of energy and a lot of ideas,” said Brase, who liked Toppert’s “vibe and positivity” during the interview process. “He’s a guy that lives in the gym.”
